Key Match Events: Steph Curry rolled his left ankle twice, forcing him to exit the game against the Los Angeles Clippers, and he didn't return after suffering a left ankle sprain.
Post-Match Reflections: Warriors head coach Steve Kerr called the sprain'mild' or'moderate', and Curry will get an MRI on Sunday night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors' hot start to the season might have been dampened.
Curry has a history of ankle injuries dating back to his first three seasons in the NBA.
Others: Curry had 18 points, four rebounds and six assists in 26 minutes before exiting the game.
He played in 74 games last season, averaging 26.4 points, 4.5 rebounds, 5.1 assists and 0.7 steals per game.
